raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Amoxicillin-clavulanate", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "This is a dog bite with cellulitis requiring antibiotic prophylaxis. Dog bites commonly involve Pasteurella multocida, Staphylococcus, Streptococcus, and anaerobes. Amoxicillin-clavulanate is the first-line treatment as it provides broad coverage including beta-lactamase producing organisms. Plain amoxicillin lacks coverage for beta-lactamase producers. Doxycycline has inadequate anaerobic coverage. Clindamycin lacks Pasteurella coverage. The presence of cellulitis 2 days post-bite indicates established infection requiring treatment, not just prophylaxis.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
